Class Arrays

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.virjoluca.util.Arrays

  • public class Arrays
extends java.lang.Object
    This class includes utilities for processing arrays
    Author:
    Luca Virjo

    • Method Detail

      • toIntArray

        public static int[] toIntArray(java.lang.String[] array)
        This method turns a String array into an int array
        Parameters:
        array - the original String array that will be converted to int
        Returns:
        the converted int array

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(int value,
                               int[] array)
        This method checks if an integer is found within an int array
        Parameters:
        value - the integer that the array is being searched for
        array - the array that is searched
        Returns:
        the boolean value true if the integer was found in the array, else it will return false

      • containsSameValues

        public static int containsSameValues(int[] array1,
                                     int[] array2)
        This method checks how many values in two int arrays are the same
        Parameters:
        array1 - the first array that is compared
        array2 - the second array that is compared
        Returns:
        the amount of values that were found in both arrays

      • print

        public static void print(int[] array)
        This method prints an int array on the command prompt
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be printed

      • removeIndex

        public static int[] removeIndex(int[] array,
                                int index)
        This method removes an index from an array
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be modified
        index - the index that is removed
        Returns:
        an array that is a copy of the original, but has had one index removed

      • sort

        public static int[] sort(int[] array)
        This method sorts an int array from the lowest value to the biggest value
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be sorted
        Returns:
        the sorted array

      • printFilled

        public static void printFilled(int[] array,
                               int size,
                               char fill)
        This method prints an array with all the contents being the same size
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be printed
        size - the total amount of character's that all of the contents will have, please note that the total amount of character's can't be smaller than the amount of characters in the largest integer in the array in order to have the method function properly
        fill - the character to be added to the contents to make them all the same size
